title: bo Practice and Disambiguation
goal: Practice using `bo` to disambiguate tanru meanings.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

bo review:

a b c (default) = ?
a b bo c = ?

(Answers: (a b) c, a (b c))

New Material (5-7 min)

New Vocabulary

Lojban Place Structure English
djine x1 is a ring/torus of material x2 ring
cinla x1 is thin in dimension x2 by standard x3 thin

Disambiguation with bo

When tanru are ambiguous, bo clarifies which grouping you mean.

Example: sutra bajra gerku

Default: (sutra bajra) gerku

  • (fast-running) dog
  • A dog that is a fast-runner

With bo: sutra bajra bo gerku

  • fast (running-dog)
  • A fast instance of a running-dog type

Alternative: sutra bo bajra gerku

  • (sutra bo bajra) gerku = ???

Wait — bo only affects adjacent words. So sutra bo bajra binds those two, giving us (sutra bo bajra) gerku = (sutra bajra) gerku. No change!

bo is useful when you want to group the RIGHT two, not the left two.

Multiple bo Usage

For longer tanru, you can use multiple bo:

a bo b bo c = a (b c)  [actually same result]

But typically one bo suffices for three-word tanru.

Practice Scenarios

Scenario 1: You want "big blue-dog"

  • Use: barda blanu bo gerku
  • Grouping: barda (blanu gerku)

Scenario 2: You want "big-blue dog"

  • Use: barda blanu gerku (default)
  • Grouping: (barda blanu) gerku

Key Point

Use bo when you want the right two words to form the core concept, with the left word modifying that compound.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Choose the Right Form

Express each meaning:

  1. (long-thin) ring → ?
  2. long (thin-ring) → ?
  3. (small-red) ball → ?
  4. small (red-ball) → ?
Answers
  1. clani cinla djine (default grouping)
  2. clani cinla bo djine
  3. cmalu xunre bolci (default grouping)
  4. cmalu xunre bo bolci

Exercise 2: Interpret Tanru

What does each mean?

  1. barda blanu kubli
  2. barda blanu bo kubli
  3. cinla xekri djine
  4. cinla xekri bo djine
Answers
  1. (big-blue) cube — a cube that is big-and-blue
  2. big (blue-cube) — a big instance of a blue cube
  3. (thin-black) ring — a ring that is thin-and-black
  4. thin (black-ring) — a thin instance of a black ring

Exercise 3: Use New Vocabulary

Translate:

  1. This is a ring.
  2. The book is thin.
  3. I see a thin black ring.
Answers
  1. ti djine
  2. la cukta cu cinla
  3. mi viska la cinla xekri djine

items.answer: (big-blue) cube — a cube that is big-and-blue
big (blue-cube) — a big instance of a blue cube
(thin-black) ring — a ring that is thin-and-black
thin (black-ring) — a thin instance of a black ring

items.text: I see a thin black ring.

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud, distinguishing the groupings:

  1. "(Big-blue) dog" → ti barda blanu gerku
  2. "Big (blue-dog)" → ti barda blanu bo gerku
  3. "This is a thin ring." → ti cinla djine

Today's Vocab

Lojban Place Structure English
djine x1 is a ring/torus of x2 ring
cinla x1 is thin in x2 by x3 thin

x1 is thin in x2 by x3

Summary

You practiced using bo to disambiguate three-word tanru. Default gives (a b) c; adding bo after the second word gives a (b c).
